an5.24:1.1: “Bhikkhus, for an unvirtuous person, one who lacks virtue, the vital condition for right composure has been destroyed.
an5.24:1.2: There being no right composure, for one who lacks right composure, the vital condition for true knowledge-and-vision has been destroyed.
an5.24:1.3: There being no accurate knowledge-and-vision, for one who lacks accurate knowledge-and-vision,  the vital condition for disenchantment and dispassion has been destroyed.
an5.24:1.4: There being no disenchantment and dispassion, for one who lacks disenchantment and dispassion, the vital condition for the knowledge-and-vision of liberation has been destroyed.
an5.24:1.5: Suppose there was a tree that lacked branches and foliage.
an5.24:1.6: Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would not grow to fullness.
an5.24:1.7: In the same way, for an unvirtuous person, one who lacks virtue, the vital condition for right composure has been destroyed.
an5.24:1.8: There being no right composure, for one who lacks right composure, the vital condition for true knowledge-and-vision has been destroyed.
an5.24:1.9: There being no accurate knowledge-and-vision, for one who lacks accurate knowledge-and-vision, the vital condition for disenchantment and dispassion has been destroyed.
an5.24:1.10: There being no disenchantment and dispassion, for one who lacks disenchantment and dispassion, the vital condition for the knowledge-and-vision of liberation has been destroyed.
an5.24:2.1: “Bhikkhus, for a virtuous person, one who has accomplished virtue, the vital condition for right composure has been accomplished.
an5.24:2.2: There being right composure, for one who has accomplished right composure, the vital condition for accurate knowledge-and-vision has been accomplished.
an5.24:2.3: There being accurate knowledge-and-vision, for one who has accomplished accurate knowledge-and-vision, the vital condition for disenchantment and dispassion has been accomplished.
an5.24:2.4: There being disenchantment and dispassion, for one who has accomplished disenchantment and dispassion, the vital condition for the knowledge-and-vision of liberation has been accomplished.
an5.24:2.5: Suppose there was a tree that was complete with branches and foliage. Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would all grow to fullness.
an5.24:2.6: In the same way, for a virtuous person, one who has accomplished virtue, the vital condition for right composure has been accomplished.
an5.24:2.7: There being right composure, for one who has accomplished right composure, the vital condition for true knowledge-and-vision has been accomplished.
an5.24:2.8: There being accurate knowledge-and-vision, for one who has accomplished accurate knowledge-and-vision, the vital condition for disenchantment and dispassion has been accomplished.
an5.24:2.9: There being disenchantment and dispassion, for one who has accomplished disenchantment and dispassion, the vital condition for the knowledge-and-vision of liberation has been accomplished.
